{"step_by_step_thinking": "Given the history of a fall from the changing table and the presence of physical findings such as subconjunctival hemorrhage and multiple bruises, child abuse should be suspected in this case. The best initial step in management is to involve social services to ensure the safety and well-being of the child. CT scan of the head may be considered if there are signs of head trauma or neurological symptoms, but it is not the best initial step in this case. Family counseling may be appropriate in the long term, but it is not the immediate priority. Rule out medical conditions may be considered, but the history and physical findings strongly suggest child abuse as the cause of the infant's condition.", "answer_choice": "B"}
